text: The Lord spoke to Moses,

“<st data-num="01696" class="">Tell</st> the <st data-num="01121 03478" class="">Israelites</st> that they must <st data-num="07725" class="">turn</st> and <st data-num="02583" class="">camp</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> <st data-num="06367" class="">Pi Hahiroth</st>, <st data-num="0996" class="">between</st> <st data-num="04024" class="">Migdol</st> and the <st data-num="03220" class="">sea</st>; you are to <st data-num="02583" class="">camp</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">by</st> the <st data-num="03220" class="">sea</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> <st data-num="01189" class="">Baal Zephon</st> <st data-num="05226" class="">opposite</st> it.<n id="2" />

<st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> will <st data-num="0559" class="">think</st><n id="1" /> regarding the <st data-num="01121 03478" class="">Israelites</st>, ‘<st data-num="01992" class="">They</st> are <st data-num="0943" class="">wandering around confused</st><n id="2" /> in the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>—the <st data-num="04057" class="">desert</st> has <st data-num="05462" class="">closed in</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> them.’<n id="3" />

I will harden Pharaoh’s heart, and he will chase after them. I will gain honor because of Pharaoh and because of all his army, and the Egyptians will know that I am the Lord.” So this is what they did.

When it was reported to the king of Egypt that the people had fled, the heart of Pharaoh and his servants was turned against the people, and the king and his servants said, “What in the world have we done? For we have released the people of Israel from serving us!”

Then he <st data-num="0631" class="">prepared</st><n id="1" /> his <st data-num="07393" class="">chariots</st> and <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> his <st data-num="05971" class="">army</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> him.
He took 600 select chariots, and all the rest of the chariots of Egypt, and officers on all of them.
But the Lord hardened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he chased after the Israelites. Now the Israelites were going out defiantly.

The <st data-num="04713" class="">Egyptians</st> <st data-num="07291" class="">chased</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> them, and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05483" class="">horses</st> and <st data-num="07393" class="">chariots</st> of <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> and his <st data-num="06571" class="">horsemen</st> and his <st data-num="02428" class="">army</st> <st data-num="05381" class="">overtook</st> them <st data-num="02583" class="">camping</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">by</st> the <st data-num="03220" class="">sea</st>, <st data-num="05921" class="">beside</st> <st data-num="06367" class="">Pi Hahiroth</st>, <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> <st data-num="01189" class="">Baal Zephon</st>.
When Pharaoh got closer, the Israelites looked up, and there were the Egyptians marching after them, and they were terrified. The Israelites cried out to the Lord,

and they <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st>, “Is it <st data-num="01097" class="">because</st> <st data-num="0369" class="">there are no</st> <st data-num="06913" class="">graves</st> in <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> that you have <st data-num="03947" class="">taken</st> us <st data-num="03947">away</st> to <st data-num="04191" class="">die</st> in the <st data-num="04057" class="">desert</st>?<n id="1" /> <st data-num="04100" class="">What</st> <st data-num="02063" class="">in the world</st><n id="2" /> have you <st data-num="06213" class="">done</st> to us by <st data-num="03318" class="">bringing</st><n id="3" /> us <st data-num="03318">out</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>?
Isn’t this what we told you in Egypt, ‘Leave us alone so that we can serve the Egyptians, because it is better for us to serve the Egyptians than to die in the desert!’”
Moses said to the people, “Do not fear! Stand firm and see the salvation of the Lord that he will provide for you today; for the Egyptians that you see today you will never, ever see again.
The Lord will fight for you, and you can be still.”
The Lord said to Moses, “Why do you cry out to me? Tell the Israelites to move on.

And as for <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="07311" class="">lift up</st> your <st data-num="04294" class="">staff</st> and <st data-num="05186" class="">extend</st> your <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">toward</st> the <st data-num="03220" class="">sea</st> and <st data-num="01234" class="">divide</st> it, so that<n id="2" /> the <st data-num="01121 03478" class="">Israelites</st> may <st data-num="0935" class="">go through</st> the <st data-num="08432" class="">middle</st> of the <st data-num="03220" class="">sea</st> on <st data-num="03004" class="">dry ground</st>.

And as for <st data-num="0589" class="">me</st>, I am <st data-num="02005" class="">going</st> to <st data-num="02388" class="">harden</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="03820" class="">hearts</st> of the <st data-num="04713" class="">Egyptians</st> so that<n id="2" /> they will <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> them, that I may be <st data-num="03513" class="">honored</st><n id="3" /> because<n id="4" /> of <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> and his <st data-num="02426" class="">army</st> and his <st data-num="07393" class="">chariots</st> and his <st data-num="06571" class="">horsemen</st>.
And the Egyptians will know that I am the Lord when I have gained my honor because of Pharaoh, his chariots, and his horsemen.”
The angel of God, who was going before the camp of Israel, moved and went behind them, and the pillar of cloud moved from before them and stood behind them.

It <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">between</st> the <st data-num="04714" class="">Egyptian</st> <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st> and the <st data-num="03478" class="">Israelite</st> <st data-num="04264">camp</st>; it <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> a <st data-num="02822" class="">dark</st> <st data-num="06051" class="">cloud</st><n id="1" /> and it <st data-num="0215" class="">lit up</st> the <st data-num="03915" class="">night</st> so that <st data-num="02088">one</st> camp did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="07126" class="">come near</st> the <st data-num="02088" class="">other</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="03605" class="">whole</st> <st data-num="03915" class="">night</st>.<n id="3" />
Moses stretched out his hand toward the sea, and the Lord drove the sea apart by a strong east wind all that night, and he made the sea into dry land, and the water was divided.
So the Israelites went through the middle of the sea on dry ground, the water forming a wall for them on their right and on their left.
The Egyptians chased them and followed them into the middle of the sea—all the horses of Pharaoh, his chariots, and his horsemen.
In the morning watch the Lord looked down on the Egyptian army through the pillar of fire and cloud, and he threw the Egyptian army into a panic.
He jammed the wheels of their chariots so that they had difficulty driving, and the Egyptians said, “Let’s flee from Israel, for the Lord fights for them against Egypt!”
The Lord said to Moses, “Extend your hand toward the sea, so that the waters may flow back on the Egyptians, on their chariots, and on their horsemen!”

So Moses extended his hand toward the sea, and the sea returned to its normal state when the sun began to rise. Now the Egyptians were fleeing before it, but the Lord overthrew the Egyptians in the middle of the sea.

The <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> <st data-num="07725" class="">returned</st> and <st data-num="03680" class="">covered</st> the <st data-num="07393" class="">chariots</st> and the <st data-num="06571" class="">horsemen</st> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="02426" class="">army</st> of <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> that was <st data-num="0935" class="">coming</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> the Israelites into the <st data-num="03220" class="">sea</st><n id="1" />—<st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">so much as</st> <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> of them <st data-num="07604" class="">survived</st>!<n id="2" />

But the <st data-num="01121 03478" class="">Israelites</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">walked</st> on <st data-num="03004" class="">dry ground</st> in the <st data-num="08432" class="">middle</st> of the <st data-num="03220" class="">sea</st>, the <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> forming a <st data-num="02346" class="">wall</st> for them on their <st data-num="03225" class="">right</st> and on their <st data-num="08040" class="">left</st>.
So the Lord saved Israel on that day from the power of the Egyptians, and Israel saw the Egyptians dead on the shore of the sea.
When Israel saw the great power that the Lord had exercised over the Egyptians, they feared the Lord, and they believed in the Lord and in his servant Moses.
